intro: Ceropegia infausta, commonly known as the devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. The plant has fleshy, succulent stems and leaves, adapted to survive in arid environments. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. Ceropegia infausta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
